message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CL. 

The paper deals with the challenge of catastrophic forgetting in neural networks and proposes a dual memory architecture inspired by human memory. This work is closely related to the fields of machine learning, neural networks, and artificial intelligence, which are covered by the cs.LG and cs.AI sub-categories. The paper also involves experiments with image datasets, which are relevant to the cs.CV sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the connection between sleep and learning in humans, which is related to the field of natural language processing covered by the cs.CL sub-category. Finally, the paper uses neural networks as a key component of the proposed architecture, which is relevant to the cs.NE sub-category.
